Legal_Issue: Whether an incomplete application submitted before regulatory changes is considered valid under the old rules
Legal_Rule: Subsection 10(6) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations states that an incomplete sponsorship application is not considered filed in the prescribed manner only for family class sponsorships
Procedural_Issue: Application returned due to missing information; validity of incomplete application post-regulatory change
Grounds_for_Claim: Incomplete application rejected after regulatory changes
Outcome_on_Merits: Case remanded for rehearing under old rules
Applicant_Challenge: Rejection of incomplete application under new rules despite prior submission date
Court_Result: Allowed judicial review; remanded for rehearing under old rules
Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 10(6), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Defendant_Response: Argued application did not exist post-regulatory changes
Outcome: Application to be reconsidered under pre-change regulations
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under section 72 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision: Section 72, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 10(6), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Governing_Rule: Subsection 10(6), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
